fragment: Jesse Pinkman asks Mike Ehrmantraut where he would go to start over.
Mike Ehrmantraut cautions Jesse Pinkman that starting over would make it impossible to make amends.
Todd Alquist takes Jesse Pinkman to his apartment to dispose of a cleaning lady.
Jane Margolis dismisses Jesse Pinkman's metaphorical view of going wherever the universe takes him.
Skinny Pete and Badger hide Jesse Pinkman's car and give him a place to sleep.
Badger devises a plan to make it appear Jesse Pinkman fled after trading his car.
Ed Galbraith refuses to help Jesse Pinkman without the full payment.
Neil Kandy challenges Jesse Pinkman to a duel for his share of the cash.
Casey distracts Lou Schanzer while Jesse Pinkman hides in Todd's apartment.
Lou Schanzer finds an old note from Todd and distracts him with conversation.
Old Joe disposes of Jesse Pinkman's car after discovering its LoJack.
Walter White has breakfast with Jesse Pinkman and talks about doing something special.
